meanings.definition: To expel an evil spirit from a person or place.
meanings.sent1: The priest exorcised the demon from the possessed girl.
meanings.sent2: The exorcist exorcised the haunted house, bringing peace to the residents.
meanings.sent3: The ghost was exorcised from the old mansion, leaving behind a sense of calm.
meanings.sent4: She felt as if a dark cloud had been exorcised from her mind after the therapy session.
meanings.sent5: The ritual to exorcise the evil spirit was intense and powerful.

meanings.definition: To rid a person or place of something harmful or disturbing.
meanings.sent1: The cleaning crew exorcised the mold from the walls of the basement.
meanings.sent2: The sage exorcised the negative energy from the room with burning herbs.
meanings.sent3: The cat exorcised the mouse from the kitchen, much to the surprise of the family.
meanings.sent4: Her morning run always exorcised the stress from her mind, leaving her refreshed.
meanings.sent5: The laughter of children seemed to exorcise the sadness from the playground.
